events.title: AUmazing Talent
events.description: An activity to show the nine emotions that form the essence of performing arts - Navras.
events.longDescription: AUmazing Talent is a unique talent showcase event dedicated to the theme of Navaras - the nine emotions that form the essence of performing arts. The event aims to bring together individuals who can express these emotions through various art forms, providing a stage for performers to showcase their talent through diverse performances. The event is open to all art forms, including dance, music, theatre, poetry, and any other creative expressions that depict the nine rasas: Shringara (Love), Hasya (Laughter), Karuna (Compassion), Raudra (Anger), Veera (Heroism), Bhayanaka (Fear), Bibhatsa (Disgust), Adbhuta (Wonder), and Shanta (Peace). Performances: Open to dance, music that embodies Navarasa.
rules: Rule 1: Content should be original and expressive
Rule 2: Performances must align with one or more of the nine rasas
Rule 3: Time limit 5 mins maximum

events.title: Jab We Code
events.description: A unique coding contest where teams of two switch contests midway and strategize together in the final phase. The final score is based on combined contest performance.
events.longDescription: Jab We Code is a unique programming contest that tests teamwork, adaptability, and strategic decision-making. Teams of two begin by solving separate contests (Contest A and Contest B) for 30 minutes before discussing their progress and swapping challenges. After another 30 minutes, they strategize once more before entering the final 20-minute phase, where both contests are open, and members decide who tackles which problem. The final ranking is determined by the combined scores of both contests. The top three teams win cash prizes.
rules: Rule 1: Teams consist of two members
Rule 2: Each member starts solving a separate coding contest
Rule 3: After 30 minutes, a 5-minute discussion is allowed before switching contests
Rule 4: After another 30 minutes, teams get a final 5-minute discussion
Rule 5: The last 20 minutes allow both members to work on separate contests simultaneously
Rule 6: The team’s total score determines the winners

events.title: Optimized Minds - Machine Learning
events.description: Teams choose one of three problem statements and develop an optimized machine learning solution using provided datasets. Solutions are judged on accuracy, efficiency, and innovation.
events.longDescription: Participants will work on one of three given problem statements, using relevant datasets to build the most optimized machine learning model. Teams will be judged based on the efficiency of their models, accuracy of predictions, and innovation in approach. The competition lasts three hours, during which teams analyze data, develop models, and present their findings. Judges will assess optimization and performance metrics to determine winners. The best-performing team for each problem statement wins ₹2000.
rules: Rule 1: Teams of 1 to 3 members
Rule 2: Each team selects one problem statement from the given options
Rule 3: Relevant datasets will be provided for analysis
Rule 4: Solutions must prioritize accuracy, efficiency, and innovation
Rule 5: Judges will evaluate based on model performance and optimization
Rule 6: One winning team per problem statement (₹2000 prize per winning team)

events.title: Hera Pheri 3.0
events.description: A three-round event combining a treasure hunt, logical reasoning quiz, and a final "Potli" hunt to determine winners. Tests problem-solving, strategy, and teamwork.
events.longDescription: This event consists of three rounds. The first is a treasure hunt, where teams solve clues to reach different campus locations. The top 10 teams move to a quiz round, where logical questions determine the final four teams. The last round is a "Potli" hunt, where teams search for hidden potlis containing different rewards. The team that finds the golden potli wins ₹5000, with runner-up receiving ₹3000. This event emphasizes problem-solving, teamwork, and quick thinking.
rules: Rule 1: Teams must complete the treasure hunt to qualify for the quiz round
Rule 2: Top 10 teams from the treasure hunt advance to the quiz round
Rule 3: Logical questions will be conducted on Discord, affecting team progression
Rule 4: The final four teams search for hidden potlis containing different prizes
Rule 5: The golden potli determines the winning team
Rule 6: Prize pool: ₹5000 (winner), ₹3000 (runner-up)

events.title: Override Protocol: Humanity's Last Stand
events.description: AI has gone rogue, and the world is about to end! Your team must outsmart the evil scientist in his own lab, solve puzzles, and uncover the kill code within 45 minutes. Work together to save humanity before time runs out!
events.longDescription: The fate of humanity is in your hands! In Override Protocol: Humanity’s Last Stand, an evil scientist has unleashed a rogue AI, and only your team can stop it. Work together in this high-stakes sci-fi escape room to uncover hidden clues, solve mind-bending puzzles, and find the elusive kill code—before time runs out! With just 45 minutes to prevent catastrophe, teamwork and quick thinking are your only hope. Gather your squad of 4-5 players and prove you can save the world! P.S. Amazing prizes await the winning team ;)
rules: Rule 1: No phones/internet allowed during game time
Rule 2: Direct disqualification if any material or clue in the room gets broken
Rule 3: Participants must report 10 minutes before the selected time slot
Rule 4: At least 4 members of the team should be present to start the game
Rule 5: Participants must not communicate with outsiders/other teams in any way that could compromise the puzzles
Rule 6: The team with the fastest record wins the game
Rule 7: In case of conflict, the organiser's decision will be final
Rule 8: No refund/ cancellation after registration

events.title: Invest-O-Mania
events.description: Join Invest-O-Mania, a Stock Market Workshop designed to help students grasp key financial concepts. Learn about market trends, stock screeners, and investment strategies in a guided session by Mentor: Kalpesh Patel.
events.longDescription: Invest-O-Mania is an exclusive Stock Market Workshop featuring the Master Trader Program (#BhavBhagvanChe) led by Mentor: Kalpesh Patel. This session is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in the world of investing. It will cover essential financial concepts, including investment strategies, risk management, stock screeners, and market indicators. The workshop aims to help students understand market trends and make informed investment decisions. Whether you're a beginner or have prior knowledge, this event will enhance your financial literacy. Plus, exciting giveaways and exclusive rewards await all participants!
rules: Rule 1: Open to all university students interested in finance & investments
Rule 2: Prior registration is mandatory
Rule 3: No prior stock market knowledge is required
Rule 4: Maintain decorum and avoid disruptions during the session

events.title: Shaft Tank
events.description: A competition to encourage students to showcase their creativity, innovation, and confidence by pitching their ideas in front of a panel of judges.
events.longDescription: Shaft Tank is designed to bring out the creativity and innovation of students by allowing them to pitch unique ideas or products. Teams of up to 3 members will present their ideas, which can be in the form of an abstract, CAD model, prototype, or a finished product. The event aims to foster confidence and provide a platform for students to showcase their skills. Judges will evaluate pitches based on idea originality, delivery, and potential investment appeal.
rules: Rule 1: Team cannot exceed 3 members
Rule 2: All soft copies related to the pitch must be submitted 48 hours before the event
Rule 3: The idea/product must be something novel
Rule 4: Any reference taken from any place must be mentioned. Plagiarism is strictly prohibited
Rule 5: Pitch cannot exceed 7 minutes
Rule 6: There will be a 10% deduction of investment if the pitch exceeds the time limit
Rule 7: Teams must reach the venue at least 30 minutes before the event. Failing to do so will result in disqualification
Rule 8: Decisions taken by the event heads and panel members will be final

events.title: RC Car Race
events.description: An RC car racing event where teams build and race their own self-fabricated cars on a challenging track with obstacles, aiming for speed, precision, and innovation.
events.longDescription: RC Car Race challenges teams to design and build their own remote-controlled cars for a thrilling competition. Participants must fabricate their cars and navigate a track filled with obstacles like gravel, dirt, ramps, and sharp turns. With strict rules on construction and fair play, the event emphasizes creativity, technical skills, and racing strategy. Teams must fine-tune their vehicles and race against opponents in multiple rounds, culminating in an exciting final lap battle to determine the champion.
rules: Rule 1: Teams must consist of 2-5 members from the same university/college
Rule 2: Participants must be pursuing undergraduate majors
Rule 3: Teams must report 45 minutes prior to the first round
Rule 4: Teams must submit a video of the car working, along with microcontroller code and car specifications
Rule 5: Only one driver is allowed to control the car at the event
Rule 6: No team member (including the driver) is allowed inside the yellow line zone enclosing the track
Rule 7: If a car goes off track, it will be disqualified from the round and event
Rule 8: A 2-second penalty will be given for minor car collisions based on judge’s decision
Rule 9: A 10-second penalty applies for deliberate bumps causing another car to go off course
Rule 10: Partial off-track violations without collision incur a 2-second penalty

events.title: Valorant
events.description: Compete in the tactical shooter game Valorant, showcasing your skills in strategy and teamwork.
events.longDescription: Join the Valorant tournament to test your skills in this fast-paced, tactical shooter game. Teams will compete in intense matches, requiring coordination, strategy, and precision. Whether you're a seasoned player or new to the game, this event offers a thrilling competitive experience with exciting prizes for the winners.
rules: Rule 1: Teams must consist of 5 players
Rule 2: Matches will follow official Valorant competitive rules
Rule 3: No cheating or use of unauthorized software allowed
Rule 4: Participants must join the designated Discord server for communication
Rule 5: Matches will be streamed live

events.title: BGMI
events.description: Battle it out in the mobile battle royale game BGMI, where strategy and survival skills are key to victory.
events.longDescription: Participate in the BGMI tournament, a battle royale experience where squads compete to be the last team standing. Test your survival skills, teamwork, and strategic thinking in intense matches. This event is perfect for mobile gaming enthusiasts looking for a competitive challenge, with exciting rewards for top performers.
rules: Rule 1: Teams must consist of 4 players
Rule 2: Matches will follow official BGMI tournament rules
Rule 3: No cheating or use of unauthorized software allowed
Rule 4: Participants must join the designated Discord server for communication
Rule 5: Matches will be streamed live

events.title: FIFA
events.description: Compete in the popular football simulation game FIFA, showcasing your skills in virtual football.
events.longDescription: Join the FIFA tournament to compete in exciting virtual football matches. Test your skills in one-on-one matches, showcasing your ability to score goals and defend against opponents. This event is perfect for football enthusiasts and gamers alike, with thrilling competition and prizes for the top players.
rules: Rule 1: Matches will follow official FIFA tournament rules
Rule 2: No cheating or use of unauthorized software allowed
Rule 3: Participants must join the designated Discord server for communication
Rule 4: Matches will be streamed live
Rule 5: Participants must use the latest version of the game

events.title: Bridge Blitz
events.description: A fast-paced bridge-building competition where teams design and test their structures under time constraints.
events.longDescription: Bridge Blitz challenges teams to design and build bridges using limited materials within a strict time limit. Test your engineering skills, creativity, and teamwork as you construct a bridge that can withstand weight and stress. This event is perfect for aspiring engineers looking for a hands-on challenge, with prizes for the strongest and most innovative designs.
rules: Rule 1: Teams must consist of 2-4 members
Rule 2: Materials will be provided at the event
Rule 3: Bridge must meet specified dimensions
Rule 4: No external tools or materials allowed
Rule 5: Judges will test bridges for weight-bearing capacity
Rule 6: Time limit for construction is 2 hours

events.title: Chy Workshop
events.description: A hands-on workshop on chemical engineering concepts, perfect for beginners and enthusiasts.
events.longDescription: Join the Chy Workshop to explore fundamental concepts of chemical engineering through interactive sessions and experiments. Learn from experts in the field and gain practical knowledge in areas such as chemical reactions, process design, and safety protocols. This workshop is ideal for students interested in chemical engineering, with opportunities for networking and skill development.
rules: Rule 1: Open to all students interested in chemical engineering
Rule 2: Prior registration is mandatory
Rule 3: Participants must follow safety protocols
Rule 4: Attendance is mandatory for certification
Rule 5: Materials will be provided at the workshop

events.title: Chy Fragrance
events.description: A unique event where participants create their own fragrances using chemical engineering principles.
events.longDescription: Chy Fragrance is a creative and educational event where participants learn to blend fragrances using chemical engineering techniques. Explore the science behind perfumery, experiment with different scents, and create your own signature fragrance. This event combines creativity with technical knowledge, offering a unique experience for chemistry enthusiasts.
rules: Rule 1: Open to all students interested in chemistry and perfumery
Rule 2: Prior registration is mandatory
Rule 3: Participants must follow safety protocols
Rule 4: Materials will be provided at the event
Rule 5: Each participant will create one fragrance

events.title: Electric Race
events.description: An event to test your electrical and logical skills to advance through a series of increasingly difficult challenges.
events.longDescription: You and your teammates are in search of a treasure long thought to be a myth. Recently, you came across an opportunity that may lead you to the treasure you seek. But your team is not the only one. Put your electrical and logical skills to the test in this melting pot of treasure hunt, code-breaking, and observation as you race against other teams to be the first to reach the lost treasure.
rules: Rule 1: Access to internet is not allowed
Rule 2: Access to a laptop and smartphones is allowed, without internet access
Rule 3: Only upon the arrival of the entire team can the team start solving the next puzzle
Rule 4: Contact with other teams or people not a part of the event, which in any form may compromise the integrity of the puzzles, is not allowed
Rule 5: The team is allowed to click photos of any resource they may consider useful during the duration of the event
Rule 6: A volunteer will be present with each team to ensure the above rules are followed

events.title: Ingenious Hackathon 6.0
events.description: The Ingenious Hackathon, a highlight of the annual Ingenium tech fest, is a hub of innovation and coding excellence. Aspiring programmers tackle real-world challenges under time constraints, testing their problem-solving skills, teamwork, and adaptability.
events.longDescription: Welcome to Ingenious Hackathon 6.0, a dynamic 36-hour innovation sprint where creativity meets technology! Whether you're a beginner taking your first steps into coding or a seasoned developer pushing the boundaries of what's possible, this is your space to build, learn, and collaborate. At Ingenious Hackathon 6.0, we believe in the power of ideas. Over the course of the event, you'll form teams, brainstorm solutions, and develop impactful projects around cutting-edge themes like AI/ML, Web3, FinTech, Sustainability, IoT, Open Innovation, and much more. We’re bringing together developers, designers, product thinkers, and creators to solve real-world challenges, build something meaningful, and connect with an inspiring tech community. Why Join? ✨ Turn your ideas into working prototypes. 🤝 Network with industry experts, mentors, and fellow innovators. 🏆 Win exciting prizes and showcase your work to top judges. 📚 Learn new skills through workshops and mentorship. 🚀 Build something that could make a difference. No matter your background or experience level, this hackathon is for YOU. So grab your laptop, fuel your creativity, and get ready to build the future.
rules: Rule 1: Only upon the arrival of the entire team can the team start solving the next puzzle
Rule 2: Contact with other teams or people not a part of the event, which in any form may compromise the integrity of the puzzles, is not allowed
Rule 3: The team is allowed to click photos of any resource they may consider useful during the duration of the event
Rule 4: A volunteer will be present with each team to ensure the above rules are followed
